resources.string: Your physical information is used for personalization and accuracy
"Keep your data up to date wherever you are. Press and hold the BACK button to sync your M400 with the mobile app. Make sure your phone has Bluetooth on."

Activity goal is a good way to find out how active you really are in your everyday life. Choose your typical activity level from three options and see how active you need to be to reach your daily activity goal.
"You can't create a training result on a future date."
Here you can set an alarm for your Polar device.
Now you need to sync your device with Flow app.
"An alarm has been set for your Polar device at %1$s %2$s Now you need to sync your device with Flow app."
"At your current weight loss trend, you'll reach normal BMI in %1$s weeks."
To connect your Polar scale (ID %1$s) with the Flow app, step on scale and wait.

Do you want to challenge yourself again? Based on your current data we recommend that you keep your weight as it is. Set yourself a goal to keep your weight the same for the coming three months. This will make sure you stick to your new balanced diet and healthy life. Go to the Flow web service to set new weight target.

Do you want to challenge yourself again? Based on your current data we recommend that you try a new weight loss program. This will guide you towards a new balanced diet and healthy life. Go to the Flow web service to set new weight target. You can do it!
Polar Balance has adjusted your daily activity goal. Please remember to sync your device.
Not enough data collected. To get guidance, you need to weigh yourself on four days within two weeks. Please remember to sync your weight.
Please measure again if you feel this is not correct.
"Please step on scale! You haven't measured your weight since %1$s."
Polar activity tracker with smart guidance
Remind me to measure my weight
Resetting your daily activity goal gives you back the original goal you got from the Flow web service. Please remember to sync your device to get the new goal in it!
"'Set goal' updates your goal both to the Flow web service and your device. Please remember to sync your device to get the new goal in it!"
Time should be between %1$d and %2$d weeks!
To get your BMI to the normal range, you should lose %1$s.
To lose %1$.2f, we recommend a period of %2$d weeks.
"Try to weigh yourself about the same time and in similar conditions. Right before breakfast would be ideal."
Turn on Bluetooth to allow Polar Balance to connect to accessories.
You are %1$s from the normal BMI range.
"We're sorry but you can't create a weight loss program. It seems that you're underweight so we can't recommend that you start a weight loss program."
Program duration was updated, and the new target date is %1$s.

"We noticed that the duration of your weight loss program was too short to reach your target. Since it wasn't possible for you to reach the target, we discontinued your program. You can now create a new weight loss program."
Weight not updated in at least 2 weeks.
The weight you just measured (%1$s) differs more than 10%% from your previous weight (%2$s).
You are eating more than you expend.
You expend more than you eat.
You got rid of %1$.1f %2$s in %3$d day.
You got rid of %1$.1f %2$s in %3$d days.
You got rid of %1$.1f %2$s in %3$d week.
You got rid of %1$.1f %2$s in %3$d week %4$d day.
You got rid of %1$.1f %2$s in %3$d week %4$d days.
You got rid of %1$.1f %2$s in %3$d weeks.
You got rid of %1$.1f %2$s in %3$d weeks %4$d day.
You got rid of %1$.1f %2$s in %3$d weeks %4$d days.
You got rid of %1$.1f kg in %2$d weeks.
You got rid of %1$.1f lbs in %2$d weeks.
"You haven't synced your activity since %1$s. Please sync your device to get accurate readings."
"You haven't synced your activity yet. Please sync your device to get accurate readings."
"You haven't synced your device yet. Please sync your device to get accurate readings."
"You haven't synced your weight or activity since %1$s. Please sync your device to get accurate readings."
"You haven't synced your weight yet. Please sync your device to get accurate readings."
"You haven't synced your weight since %1$s. Please sync your device to get accurate readings."
Your BMI is normal. Great! Keep up the good work!
Your weight target should be between %1$.2f and %2$.2f.
Hmm, that email address is in use. Please try a different one.

Type in the new email address you want to associate with your Polar account. This email will now be used to sign in to Polar services and we will use this email address to contact you about important information regarding your Polar account.
"Sorry, email wasn't changed - something went wrong at our end."
Change the email associated with your Polar account.

"You're about to change the email address you've associated with your Polar account. If you change the email address, the new address you provide will be used to sign in to Polar services. Type in your password to continue."
Your email address was changed. Check your email!
"Your new email address doesn't seem quite right. Please check the format!"
%1$s requires an update to the Android Wear app.
"%1$s won't run unless you update the Android Wear app."
"Sorry, email wasn't sent - something went wrong at our end."
%1$s requires one or more Google Play services that are not currently available. Please contact the developer for assistance.
"%1$s won't work unless you enable Google Play services."
"%1$s won't run without Google Play services, which are missing from your phone."
"%1$s won't run without Google Play services, which are missing from your tablet."
The specified account does not exist on this device. Please choose a different account.
An application requires Google Play services to be enabled.
A data connection is required to connect to Google Play services.
An application requires an update for Google Play services.
Error signing in the specified account. Please choose a different account.
Unknown issue with Google Play services.
%1$s relies on Google Play services, which is not supported by your device. Contact the manufacturer for assistance.
"%1$s won't run unless you update Google Play services."
"%1$s won't run without Google Play services, which are currently updating."
To start using Flow app, please connect your Polar Loop by pressing the button on the product.

"Please make sure that your %1$s firmware is up to date. Connect %2$s to your computer using the USB cable to get the latest update. Also check that you have enabled Bluetooth on your phone and that your %3$s is not in flight mode."
To connect your A300 (ID %1$s) with the Flow app, press and hold the A300 BACK button.
To connect your A360 (ID %1$s) with the Flow app, press and hold the A360 button.
To connect your A370 (ID %1$s) with the Flow app, press and hold the A370 button.
To connect your M200 (ID %1$s) with the Flow app, press and hold the M200 button.
To connect your M400 (ID %1$s) with the Flow app, press and hold the M400 BACK button.
To connect your M430 (ID %1$s) with the Flow app, press and hold the M430 BACK button.
To connect your M450 (ID %1$s) with the Flow app, press and hold the M450 BACK button.
To connect your V650 (ID %1$s) with the Flow app, select %2$s from your V650 side menu.
To connect your V800 (ID %1$s) with the Flow app, press and hold the V800 BACK button.
To connect your Polar Loop 2 (ID %1$s) with the Flow app, tap the Polar Loop 2 touch button. Wait for the Polar Loop 2 display to turn off so that syncing can begin.
To connect your %2$s (ID %1$s) with the Flow app, tap the %2$s touch button. Wait for the %2$s display to turn off so that syncing can begin.
You need to agree to use Flow.
I agree that my personal data may be transferred and processed outside my country of origin as described in the Polar Privacy Notice.

"Ticking this box means that you give Polar permission to transfer your data outside the country where you live.
This is because we operate all over the world and the services we provide to you may sometimes require using resources that are located outside the country where you live, or outside the EU."
As guardian I give Polar permission to collect and process personal data of the young person in question as described in the Polar Privacy Notice.

"Ticking this box means that you, as the guardian, give Polar permission to create a Polar account for the young person in question and to collect, store and manage their personal data such as email, age and location.
Personal data is required for Polar to provide this service."
"As the account user is under 13 we need a guardian's consent to create a Polar account."
"Yes, I'd like to hear about offers and services from Polar."

"We're constantly developing our services and that's why we'd love to occasionally send you the Polar Newsletter so that you can stay in the know. You can always change this setting if you change your mind."
I agree that Polar may collect and process my personal data as described in the Polar Privacy Notice.

"Ticking this box means that you give Polar permission to collect, store and manage the personal information you give us when you create an account, such as your email, age and location.
Your personal data is used to create and manage your Polar account."
I want to keep using Polar services

"We've updated our Privacy Notice and the Polar Terms of Use. Please review them and manage your consents regarding the use of your data in the Profile settings under Privacy to keep using Polar services."
"Your account is temporarily locked because you haven't given your consent to the use of your data."

"You've withdrawn some of the mandatory consents regarding the use of your data. To use Flow you need to agree to the use of your data as described in our Privacy Notice — otherwise we can't offer our services to you. You can manage your consents in the Profile settings."
I agree that Polar may collect and process my sensitive personal data such as heart rate as described in the Polar Privacy Notice.

"Ticking this box means that you give Polar permission to collect, store and manage your sensitive personal data such as your heart rate data.
Heart rate data is the basis of Polar Smart Coaching, so to be able to guide you in your training we need to be able to synchronize your training data from your device to our service."
I have read and agree to the Polar Terms of Use

Continuous heart rate works together with the accelerometer-based activity tracking: your device measures your heart rate every few minutes, and starts continuous tracking if your heart rate or activity level is elevated.
Highest heart rate of the day
Lowest heart rate of the day
Long press and slide for details
Another training is already scheduled for that time
To get feedback, you need to wear your product for more than 10 hours, not including sleep or rest.
Not so active day. Try again tomorrow?
Somewhat active day. These activity levels can make a small improvement to your health.
Reasonably active day. This is a good baseline to see long-term health benefits.
Quite an active day. You will improve your health levels if you continue like this.
You were quite active today, improving both health and fitness levels. Well done!
Nice active day, improving your health. Well done!
You combined activity and exercise and improved your health and fitness. Good work!
Well done, good amount of activity. This will really benefit your health!
Wow. A lot of activity, plus some exercise. You get healthier with days like this.
Impressive! A lot of activity and exercise. This significantly improves both your health and fitness.
"You're a star! So much activity and exercise today. You will see and feel the health and fitness benefits."
If your day includes only a little sports and a lot of sitting, commuting by car or public transport and so on, we recommend you pick this activity level.
If you spend most of your day on your feet, perhaps due to the type of work you do or your daily chores, this is the right activity level for you.
"If your work is physically demanding, you're into sports or otherwise tend to be on the move and active, this is the activity level for you."
You were sitting for most of the day. Try to break it up with a short walk.
You were sitting for most of the day. Break it up more often.
You were sitting for most of the day. Happy you did not sit too long at a time.
You were sitting for quite a few hours. Try to break it up tomorrow.
You were sitting for quite a few hours. Happy you did not sit too long at a time.
You did not sit down for very long which will help you to stay healthy.
"You only sat a little today. That's great, keep it up!"
Your %1$s is ready to be taken in use with your phone.
You need to pair and set up your %1$s before starting to use it. You can do the setup right here, or on your computer.
Verification message is on its way!
To be able to sync your Polar device, you need to enable location services on your phone.
POLAR ELECTRO END-USER SOFTWARE AGREEMENT FOR APPLICATIONS
You need to train at least 10 minutes above 50% of your calculated maximum heart rate value to get feedback.
What a session! You improved your sprint speed and the nervous system of your muscles, which make you more efficient. This session also increased your resistance to fatigue.
What a session! You improved your sprint speed and the nervous system of your muscles, which make you more efficient.
What a session! You improved your speed and efficiency. This session also significantly developed your aerobic fitness and your ability to sustain high intensity effort for longer.
What a session! You significantly improved your aerobic fitness and your ability to sustain high intensity effort for longer. This session also developed your speed and efficiency.
Great pace in a long session! You improved your aerobic fitness, speed, and ability to sustain high intensity effort for longer. This session also increased your resistance to fatigue.
Great pace! You improved your aerobic fitness, speed, and ability to sustain high intensity effort for longer.
Good pace! You improved your ability to sustain high intensity effort for longer. This session also developed your aerobic fitness and the endurance of your muscles.
Good pace! You improved your aerobic fitness and the endurance of your muscles. This session also developed your ability to sustain high intensity effort for longer.
Excellent! This long session improved the endurance of your muscles and your aerobic fitness. It also increased your resistance to fatigue.
Excellent! You improved the endurance of your muscles and your aerobic fitness.
"Excellent! This long session improved the endurance of your muscles and your aerobic fitness. It also developed your basic endurance and your body's ability to burn fat during exercise."
"Excellent! You improved the endurance of your muscles and your aerobic fitness. This session also developed your basic endurance and your body's ability to burn fat during exercise."
"Great! This long session improved your basic endurance and your body's ability to burn fat during exercise. It also developed the endurance of your muscles and your aerobic fitness."
"Great! You improved your basic endurance and your body's ability to burn fat during exercise. This session also developed the endurance of your muscles and your aerobic fitness."
"Great! This long, low intensity session improved your basic endurance and your body's ability to burn fat during exercise."
"Well done! This low intensity session improved your basic endurance and your body's ability to burn fat during exercise."
Very nice session for your recovery. Light exercise like this allows your body to adapt to your training.
"This summary with your name and photo will be visible to other Flow users. Your profile will remain private. Continue?"
%1$s %2$s commented on your activity summary on %3$s.
%1$s %2$s commented on your %3$s training session on %4$s.
"Your feed is still empty, but as soon as you connect with your friends, you'll see what they've been up to lately."
"Your feed is still empty, but as soon as you gain some training or activity data, the feed will show what you've been up to lately. You can also see your friends' activities and comment them."
You can go to Support later and check how to get started.
Your %1$s is almost ready for use.
Please bring your phone and %1$s close to each other.
Connect your phone and %1$s to a power source to continue the update.
Please keep your phone and %1$s close to each other during the update.
Connect %1$s to a power source to continue the update.
Connect your phone to a power source to continue the update.
Syncing failed. If you continue the update, some of your data will be lost.
You need to update your %1$s firmware to continue using Polar Flow. This may take up to %2$s minutes.
Jogging, running and other intense activities
Standing work, light household chores and other light activities
Ways to reach your activity goal
This will create training results and training target calendars to your Google Calendar. If wanted, these can also be shown in your other calendar apps
Make sure you have Google Calendar installed to your device. It is needed for syncing calendars.
Please check your Internet connection. It is needed for creating calendars to Google Calendar.
To see the calendar(s), go to Google calendar settings to turn on calendar syncing and refresh your Google Calendar.
Calendar named %1$s already exists. Do you wish to use this calendar? Please note that the existing events in the calendar may be overridden.
Google Fit is an open platform that lets you control your fitness data from multiple apps and devices.
"Keep your data up to date wherever you are. Press and hold the BACK button to sync your V800 with the mobile app. Make sure your phone has Bluetooth on."
To sync your A300 with the Flow app, press and hold the A300 BACK button.
To sync your A360 with the Flow app, press and hold the A360 button.
To sync your A370 with the Flow app, press and hold the A370 button.
To sync your M200 with the Flow app, press and hold the M200 button.
To sync your M400 with the Flow app, press and hold the M400 BACK button.
To sync your M430 with the Flow app, press and hold the M430 button.
To sync your M450 with the Flow app, press and hold the M450 BACK button.
To sync your M460 with the Flow app, press and hold the M460 BACK button.
Your OH1 is synced automatically after training.
To sync your V650 with the Flow app, select %1$s from the side menu of your V650.
To sync your V800 with the Flow app, press and hold the V800 BACK button.
To sync your %1$s with the Flow app, tap the activity tracker touch button. Wait for the activity tracker display to turn off so that syncing can begin.
To sync your Polar Loop 2 with the Flow app, tap the activity tracker touch button. Wait for the activity tracker display to turn off so that syncing can begin.
Your %1$s syncs your training and activity data to Flow app automatically.

"Unfortunately your mobile device (%1$s %2$s) does not support mobile syncing with %3$s
Please continue with Polar Flow web service on your computer: flow.polar.com"
Move your legs, stand up, walk around.

You have been inactive for 1 hour. Sitting for long periods is bad for your blood circulation, especially in your legs. Sitting only uses low amounts of energy, which can make it more difficult to control your weight.
You have been inactive for %d hour
You were inactive for one hour
Move your legs, stand up, walk around.
Breaking up long periods of sitting helps your blood circulation, especially in your legs. It also adds to your energy expenditure and boosts your metabolism.
Jogging, running and other intense activities
Choose what you want to see in the lap view during your sessions. This information is shown for both manual and automatic lap.
"Polar Flow tracks all your training and activity - anywhere, anytime"
The emails do not match. Please retype your email.
"You can't sign in because your mobile device is not connected to the Internet."
Polar Flow web service is under maintenance. Please try again later.
Check your username and password. To register or get a new password, visit polar.com/flow.
Oops! Looks like you typed the wrong password.
The passwords do not match. Please retype your password.
Polar Flow web service is currently unavailable. Please try again later.
Your training device can contain up to %1$s sport profiles. You can keep adding sports, just arrange them with the most important ones on the top on your list in your device.
You have reached the maximum number of sport profiles
Are you sure you want to sign out?
Allowing Flow app to access your location lets you get speed and distance during training. To allow access, enable location services on your phone.
Allow Flow app to use your current location?
Use your phone’s GPS to track the speed and distance during your outdoor workouts. To get GPS information, keep your mobile device at hand and give Polar Flow app permission to use your location.
Sending GPS data to Polar A370
To get feedback, you need to wear your product for more than 10 hours a day on at least 21 days, not including sleep or rest.
Very low activity month. With small increases in your levels of activity you will look and feel healthier.
Low activity month. With small increases in your levels of activity you will look and feel healthier.
"Somewhat active month. You're on your way to a healthier life."
Reasonably active month that will maintain your health.
Quite an active month that will enhance your health.
Very active month including exercise. This will enhance your health.
"Very active month. You'll feel much healthier."
Very active month with high intensity exercise. This will strongly enhance your health.
Very active month. This will strongly enhance your health.
Super active month with a good mix of activity and exercise. At this level you get advanced health benefits.
Super active month with high intensity exercise. At this level you get advanced health benefits. Keep this up for a long and healthy life!
Super active month. With large amounts of high-level exercise, you get major health and fitness improvements.
Sitting down many hours for long periods is unhealthy. Try breaking it up.
Sitting down many hours is unhealthy. Aim for fewer next month?
You were sitting down for many hours. Happy you did not sit for very long periods.
You spent quite a lot of time sitting down for long periods.
You spent quite a lot of time sitting down.
You did not sit down for very long which will help you to stay healthy.
You only sat down a little this month which is good for your health.

"Polar Flow is all about your training and hard work — moreover, your data.That's why we ask you to review our Privacy Notice and go through these settings about the privacy of your data and how you allow us to handle it."
I have read the Polar Privacy Notice.
Please make sure that you have Android Wear app installed and you have connected Polar M600 with it.
Start the initial setup by connecting %1$s with Android Wear app.
Reach your training goals with our free app, Polar Beat. It gives you voice guidance and tracks your distance, pace and route.
The easiest way to Polar training
Got a new Polar device with mobile setup?
The setup in Polar Flow web service is compatible with the following devices: %1$s.
Polar mobile setup is compatible with the following devices: %1$s.
To get started, please go to the Polar Flow web service with your computer:
Please make sure both your phone and device have Bluetooth turned on, and keep them close to each other during the setup. Alternatively, you can do the setup with your computer if you wish.
You can do the initial setup right here with your phone.
Polar Flow app lets you get the most out of your product on the go. To get started, activate your product with your PC or Mac at:
"Oops, couldn't connect to server - you're offline."
Sorry, something went wrong at our end - try again.
Polar Flow app lets you get the most out of your device on the go. To get started, you need to set up your device.
"Here you can manage your sport profiles. To do this you need a compatible training device, such as Polar V800."
You get an alert if you are inactive longer than 1 hour.
"%1$s %2$s commented on something that you've commented."
There are no notifications at this time.
Heart rate training session started. To end the session, take your heart rate sensor off.
Your phone may have a compatibility issue with %1$s. Tap here for more information.
Your phone may have a compatibility issue with Polar devices. Tap here for more information.
"Flow app needs permission to access your phone's calendar to add training data to your Google calendar."
Flow app needs permission to access your contacts to give you notifications about incoming calls.
Flow app needs permission to access your location to sychronize your device.
Flow app needs permission to access your phone to give you notifications about incoming calls.
Flow app needs permission to access your storage to share images from your phone.
Storage permission is needed to update your profile image.
Press and hold the %1$s BACK button to sync

To use a Polar account and the Polar Flow service you need to agree with the use of your data as described in the Polar Privacy Notice. Here you can manage your consents and learn more about how Polar uses your data.
Be happily public, keep to yourself, or limit sharing to followers only.
Verify your email address to keep using Polar Flow.
"Your email address needs to be verified. We've sent you a verification message via email."
"If so, would you mind rating it? We'd love to hear what you think. It'll only take a moment. Thanks!"
"Type in the email address you want to associate with your Polar account. We'll send you a verification message to this email address."
You can go to settings later and check how to get started.
"You can't sign up because your mobile device is not connected to the Internet."
Please fill in all required fields.
Username must be an email address. Password must have at least 8 characters.
Sign in to Polar Flow or create a new Polar account.
"I'd like to receive information on software updates, products, services and special offers that I may find interesting."
Fill in your details to create a Polar account.
Fill in your physical details, activity level and training background for more accurate guidance and interpretation of your training sessions.
Sport profile is removed from your list and the sport specific settings will be lost.
Select %1$s from the side menu of your V650
Not possible to connect to service at the moment. Polar Flow web service connection not available.
Settings have been changed. Please sync your device with Flow app.
Please choose where you want to wear your product.
To see all the device settings, please sync your device.
Data is kept fully in application once it is synced.
We will clean up data older than [%1$s] from Flow app. Later on data is cleaned up automatically from Flow app when you launch it. Your data is still safe.
Keep data in local memory for
Your mobile device is not compatible for syncing with %1$s
You have %1$s days left to verify your email address.
"You need to verify the email address you've associated with your Polar account to keep using Polar Flow. Check your email for a verification message."
Your account is temporarily locked because your email is not yet verified.
"We've sent the verification message to this email address:"

"Too bad, you didn't sleep as long as you wanted to. The quality of your sleep was also poor. Try and look back if you can spot anything that may have influenced your sleep. A bad night is nothing to worry about, just as long as it doesn't happen too frequently."

"You slept quite restlessly. You didn't sleep as long as you planned to, and the quality of your sleep was rather poor. But it looks like you're still feeling refreshed, so no need to worry. It might be worth checking if anything comes to mind that may have interfered with your sleep."

"Too bad, you didn't sleep as long as you wanted to. Because you also spent quite a bit of time awake the quality of your sleep wasn't ideal. On the positive side, when you did actually sleep your sleep was rather solid. See if you can spot anything that may have interfered with your sleep."

"You slept fairly well. You didn't sleep as long as you wanted to, and because you also spent quite a bit of time awake the quality of your sleep wasn't ideal. However, when you did actually sleep your sleep was rather solid and it looks like you're feeling refreshed."

"Too bad, you didn't sleep as long as you wanted to. Your sleep was also interrupted quite a few times. No need to worry though, it's perfectly normal to have a bad night every now and then. See if you can spot anything that may have interfered with your sleep."

"You slept fairly well. You didn't sleep as long as you wanted to, however, and your sleep was interrupted quite a few times. On the positive side, you didn't spend too much time awake, and looks like you're feeling rested."

"Too bad, you didn't sleep as long as you wanted to. However, the overall quality of your sleep was good. Since you don't feel like you slept that well, try and look back to see what may have affected your sleep."
"You slept quite well. Even though you didn't sleep as long as you wanted to the overall quality of your sleep was good. You're ready to take on the day!"

"Great that you've slept as long as you planned to. However, since you spent quite a lot of time awake and your sleep was frequently interrupted the quality of your sleep wasn't ideal. Try and look back if you can spot anything that may have interfered with your sleep."

"Good for you, you've slept as long as you planned to. You did spend quite a lot of time awake and your sleep was frequently interrupted, so the quality of your sleep perhaps wasn't ideal. No need to worry though, it looks like you're still feeling refreshed."

"Good for you, you've slept as long as you planned to and your sleep was quite continuous. However, because you spent quite a lot of time awake the quality of your sleep wasn't ideal. Try and look back to see what may have interfered with your sleep."

"You slept quite well. You've slept as long as you planned to and your sleep was continuous. You did spend quite a lot of time awake, so the quality of your sleep wasn't ideal. But it looks like you're still feeling rested and ready to take on the day."

"Good for you, you've slept as long as you planned to and you didn't spend too much time awake. There were quite a few interruptions though, which might explain why you didn't sleep that well. See if you can spot anything that may have interfered with your sleep."

"You slept quite well. You've slept as long as you planned to and you didn't spend too much time awake. There were quite a few interruptions though, which suggests that the quality of your sleep perhaps wasn't ideal. But since you're feeling rested, there's no need to worry."

"Good for you, you've slept as long as you planned to and the quality of your sleep was good. However, since you don't feel like you slept that well, you could try and see if you'd benefit from a longer night's sleep."

"Good for you, you've slept as long as you planned to and the quality of your sleep was good. However, since you don't feel like you slept that well, see if you can spot anything that might have interfered with your sleep."
You slept great. Both the quality and duration of your sleep was good. Today has the makings of a good day!
Less sleep than preferred, poor quality
Less sleep than preferred, lots of awake time
Less sleep than preferred, lots of interruptions
Less sleep than preferred, good overall quality
Preferred amount of sleep, poor quality
Preferred amount of sleep, lots of awake time
Preferred amount of sleep, many interruptions
Preferred amount of sleep, good quality

The key to a healthy body and mind is allowing yourself enough sleep. Tracking your sleep allows you to monitor the quality of your sleep, rate how you slept and receive feedback based on the tracked data. Wear your device during sleep to get all this.
As soon as you start receiving notifications from an app, the app will be listed here and you can block it if you wish.
To be able to receive smart notifications, you need to enable notifications on your phone.
"Here you can choose if you'd like to see smart notifications on your Polar device. You can also disable notifications for certain hours of the day, and block them from certain apps."
Do you really want to discard all changes?

"Add some fun into your training with these alternative training views. With the World record comparison you'll be able to see how close to the world record speed you can get, and what it takes to run at that speed. Your training device let's you know when you've hit the world record speed."
If you turn the Back to start function on, the location guide will guide you back to your original starting point.

"The Cooper test result let's you know what test results you would get if you ran the test at your current pace. Cooper test results vary from 1000+, 2000+, 3000+ up to 4000+ meters. This display gives you an idea of the effort it takes to run the top results of 3000m or 4000m."
If you turn the Force graph on on your device, you can see how much force you use against pedal when cycling.
Choose the training zones you want to see on your training device during your sessions.

"Automatic lap is taken automatically each time you cross the set duration or distance interval.
Location-based automatic lap is taken every time you arrive at the point where you started the session."
To use the Automatic pause, you need a GPS or speed sensor. Your sessions pause automatically when you stop, and continue automatically when you start.
Set a speed limit for automatic pause. When your speed goes below the defined speed, your session is paused automatically.

Exercise intensity at which anaerobic metabolism increases and blood lactate starts to accumulate. This is the highest exercise intensity that can be sustained for a prolonged period. In cycling this is also known as Functional Threshold Power (FTP). If you have measured your actual threshold, you can insert it here.
High accuracy: Measures GPS information once every second.
Medium accuracy: Measures GPS information once every half minutes.
Power save: Measures GPS information once every minute. Use this to save device battery on long sessions.
Bring your training device close to your heart rate sensor during your session to activate HeartTouch.
When you allow your heart rate to be visible to other devices, your heart rate can be detected by certain gym equipment.

"With the heart rate zones you can easily select and monitor training intensities. The zones you see here are default zones based on your maximum heart rate and they are always a good option.
If you want, you can turn on the Free zones option and edit your zones. For example, if you have tested your actual thresholds, such as anaerobic and aerobic thresholds, or upper and lower lactate thresholds, you can modify the zones based on your individual thresholds. Training Benefit is also then based on these zones.
We recommend that you set your anaerobic threshold as the minimum heart rate of zone 5. If you also use aerobic threshold, set that as the minimum of zone 3. The minimum of zone 4 is halfway between zones 3 and 5."

With the power zones you can easily select and monitor training intensities.The zones you see here are default zones calculated from a rough estimate of your anaerobic (or functional) threshold power based on your weight. If you choose the Free zones option, all limits can be changed. If you know your threshold power, please set the accurate value here. This will also update your default values according to your new threshold.

"With the speed/pace zones you can easily select and monitor your speed or pace, depending on your selection. The zones you see here are default zones and they are an example of speed/pace zones for a person with a relatively high fitness level.
If you turn on the Free zones option, all limits can be changed. For example, if you have tested your actual thresholds, such as anaerobic and aerobic thresholds, or upper and lower lactate thresholds, you can train with zones based on your individual threshold speed or pace.
We recommend that you set your anaerobic threshold speed and pace as the minimum for zone 5. If you also use aerobic threshold, set that as the minimum of zone 3. The minimum of zone 4 is halfway between zones 3 and 5."
Choose the data you want to see on your training views during your sessions. Some of the data you see in your training views also depends on the sensors you have and your settings.

"With Zone lock you can lock the zone you’re currently in based on heart rate, speed/pace or power, and make sure you stay on the chosen zone during training without having to check your device. If you go outside the locked zone during training, you’ll get audio feedback from your device.
To activate Zone lock on your device press and hold the start button to lock the zone you are currently in. To lock/unlock the zone, press and hold the start button again. If you’re using more than one zone at the same time your device will ask you to choose the one you want to lock.
If, for example, you are running with a heart rate of 130 bpm which is 75% of your maximum heart rate, and matches sport zone 3, you can press and hold START to lock your heart rate into this zone. Sport zone 3 Locked 70%-79% is then displayed on your training device."
You need at least one display
The value must be between 1 and 45 characters.
Limits must be further apart from each other.
Please enter a value between next and previous zone. Zone limits must be at least %1$s %2$s apart from each other.
The Polar sport profiles for Les Mills workouts are now available on Polar Flow. Choose your favorite workouts and enjoy!
Choose this if you want to see an altitude graph together with altitude related figures as one of your training views.
Choose this if you want your device to guide you back to your original starting point. You will see location guide as one of your training views.
Choose this if you want to use the countdown timer during your sessions. To use the timer, you need find it among your training displays and set it with your watch.
Choose this if you want to see a cadence graph together with your current, average and maximum cadence as one of your training views.
Choose this if you want to see a heart rate graph together with your current, average and maximum heart rate as one of your training views.
"Choose this if you want to see the times you've spent in each heart rate zone as one of your training views."
Choose this if you want to use the interval timer during your sessions. To use the timer, you need find it among your training displays and set it with your watch.
Choose this if you want to see a pace graph together with your current, average and maximum pace as one of your training views.

Choose this if you want to see pedaling force related data as one of your training views.
Choose this if you want to see a power graph together with your current, average and maximum power as one of your training views.
"Choose this if you want to see the times you've spent in each power zone as one of your training views."
Choose this if you want to see a cadence graph together with your current, average and maximum cadence as one of your training views.
Choose this if you want to see a speed graph together with your current, average and maximum speed as one of your training views.
"Choose this if you want to see the times you've spent in each speed zone as one of your training views."
Choose this if you want to see automatic lap times as one of your training views. You can choose either time, distance or location based automatic laps for each sport profile.
Choose this if you want to see lap times as one of your training views.
Choose this if you want to follow Strava segments and see them as one of your training views.
Choose this if you want to see a stroke rate graph together with your current, average and maximum stroke rate as one of your training views.
Choose this if swimming drills are part of your training and you want to see drill data as one of your training views.
"Choose this if you want to see the percentages of time you've spent in each heart rate zone as one of your training views."
"Choose this if you want to see the percentages of time you've spent in each pace zone as one of your training views."
"Choose this if you want to see the percentages of time you've spent in each power zone as one of your training views."
"Choose this if you want to see the percentages of time you've spent in each speed zone as one of your training views."
Choose this if you want to see time of day as one of your training views.

To get feedback, you need to wear your product for more than 10 hours a day on at least 5 days, not including sleep or rest.
Not so active week. Try taking several short walks next week.
Low activity week. Do some gentle exercising next week.
"Somewhat active week. This week's activity levels will make a small improvement to your health."
"Reasonably active week. Keep this up and you'll see long-term health improvements."
That was quite an active week. You will improve your health levels if you continue like this.
You combined activity and exercise this week improving both health and fitness levels!
Nice active week, improving your health. Your body says thank you.
You combined activity and exercise. This will make you healthier and fitter. Way to go!
Well done, you were very active this week. This is really good for your health!
"You've had a very good mix of activity and exercise this week. If you carry on like this, chances are there's a long and healthy life ahead of you."
Great! Loads of activity and exercise this week. This significantly improves both your health and fitness.
"What a great week! You've been working really hard. You will see and feel the health and fitness benefits. Your mind should be sharper and your body will look and feel better."
Sitting down many hours for long periods is unhealthy. Try breaking it up.
Sitting in place for a long time is unhealthy. Try to do it a bit less next week.
You were sitting down for many hours. Happy you did not sit for very long periods.
"You spent quite a lot of time sitting down for long periods. You'll see more health benefits if you reduce this."
"You spent quite a lot of time sitting down. You'll see more health benefits if you reduce this."
You did not sit down for very long which will help you to stay healthy.
"You only sat a little this week. That's great, keep it up!"
